alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 4:07AM EST until December 18 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTER STORM EXPECTED THROUGH SATURDAY... .A coastal storm developing near Cape May New Jersey will move northeast today and strengthen as it crosses southern New England. This will bring the first widespread winter storm to the local area though Saturday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Wet Snow expected. Total snow of 2 to 5 inches with the greatest amounts north of Route 1. * WHERE...Coastal Waldo, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc, and Coastal Cumberland Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to Midnight EST Saturday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel will be slick due to snow accumulations on roads. Wet snow at times may lead to downed tree limbs, resulting in scattered power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with or possibly change to rain for a time today before changing to all snow this evening and overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc
